Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: bebibm
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel close to the airport (Thing Yi), good transfers, easy to reach. A good choice if your plane sets off early, but could be cheaper for a transit hotel. The taxi to the airport is not expensive. The room is pleasant, nicely furnished, with a beautiful view of the port, but not the biggest one. The bathroom have everything you need, including a hairdrier, and is very clean. The breakfast is not included in the price, can be ordered extra ( room service.) . Water boiler, coffee, tea, sugar etc. is available in the room, Wonderful pool for an extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no extras”
Reviews.Author: SadjzSumague
Reviews.Content: We went here using a package tours included. Room was okay but no bathtub. There is a charge for wifi access so with a customized 3 prong electric plug. The room and hotel surroundings is well maintain and quite accessible since there is a bus going to Tsing Yi. Overall, it would be a good place to stay nevertheless, if I sum up the package price I've paid, the accommodation seems to be a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basic hotel with good transport links”
Reviews.Author: Gareth E
Reviews.Content: Have used this hotel 3 times. This review is based on business needs, not pleasure. - Cheap by Hong Kong standards - Near Tsing Yi mall MTR / airport express station. Meaning good transport links, to Airport, Kowloon & HK Island - Clean modern rooms - Aircon - Has a 7/11 and minimarket in the basement, both sell lots of Western food and drink. Ideal for a Westerner who otherwise struggles with Chinese food. From a business travelers point of view its ideal, if visiting as a tourist I imagine review would be differant.

Reviews.Title: “stressful stay”
Reviews.Author: babyalexandrea
Reviews.Content: We were four and stayed 2 nights only in two twin rooms. The rooms were clean yet so small for us. In fairness, we enjoyed the beddings and aircon. It was accessible to MTR Tsing Yi and had hourly service.. our agency told us that it was FREE shuttle service but it was not, it costed 8hkd per person. Breakfast was provided but you needed to walk 5minutes before you could eat and passed thru noisy and unkind chinese people. Receptionists were not accommodating and friendly except for Lo who assisted us in giving adaptor. Overall, would not definitely come back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic price, but poor in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: Gurobuzz
Reviews.Content: At first glance of the hotel information it would appear that this is a bargain, look again. The quoted price of the room was 72.00 a night, that would be 288 for 4 nights- wrong. It came out to 477.00 after all the extras. Not to mention the contracted laundry. To wash a shirt- 26.00hk, a pair of pants- 56.00 hk 10 pounds of clothes quickly added up to 880.00 hk- that is 125. US to do one small load of laundry. Now for the picturesque pool and court yard, 50.00 hk to use it and they have it blocked off so you cannot walk it or enjoy the view. Going up and down the elevator is worse than the NY subway with pushy Chinese who talk at full volume when using their cell phones and shove you out of their way to go out of the elevator. Make sure to verify the costs before you go there. If you do not mind walking 2 blocks to get a coke or a bottle of water. Taxis were abundant and were very courteous and helpful. Its location was what sold us on the hotel, pretty close to an Mtr station and all of the HK attractions. Everything else was a definite turn off. The restaurant next door is nice, but very expensive for basic foods. The rooms are nice- but the staff was not well versed in English.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel to crash.”
Reviews.Author: sandsyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, o/a it is a clean, neat & awesome place to stay in. We got the 27th floor, 2 twin rooms, each sized enough for 2 adults. Room service was excellent. We were there in early February, temperature ranged from 14degrees to 16degrees. All the basic needs are provided except that the mini fridge doesn't seem to be working although the power is switched on. We bought milk, it didn't last two days even though we hadn't opened it. Our Haagen Dasz ice cream melted overnight. Front desk lady wasn't at her best attitude (she raised her voice & shouted at us) when we enquired twice for our room which was due at 1400hrs instead we had to wait another 45 mins and were impatient when other tourists got their rooms every few minutes after 1400hrs. We arrived at 0900hrs as we took a night flight & we understand the check-in hours is not due till then, but we couldn't even sit at the waiting area with drinks & few packets of snacks. We were told off a few times & the terrible thing is that we weren't making any noises, disturbing others or even littering, not to mention my friends couldn't even close their eyes for a short rest. There wasn't any free shuttle bus as per written in the website inclusive with the schedule. Instead we took mini bus 88F to & fro throughout our stay. Early that morning when we arrived, we made calls to the hotel to enquire about this but the phone was passed around, then finally one short info which is 'take exit A and bus 88F' & got hung up. The hotel has got a shipping port view, which is really wonderful, especially at night. The view was excellent & it is entirely a new experience. The website included beautiful pictures of the sky garden, but when we got up there, it was empty. No water, no chess set, nothing. We did not consume anything from the hotel as we are Muslims. We bought food from the nearest mall & whatever else from home. A must have for free & easy travelers: a) Airport Express bundle card b) Octopus card (Refundable) (Absolutely must have) c) Map of this hotel location & of course HK itself. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good place to crash, safe for the belongings & who don't mind the little cumbersome location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, if you don't mind being 30 min. from "downtown"”
Reviews.Author: EliasNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel, as other have indicated, is about a 20 min ride from the airport: Airport Express to Tsing Yi (HK$60 or HK$110 round trip) plus taxi (about HK$23-25) Pluses: * If you need to be near the airport area, I can't think of a better choice. Rates are less than half of the immediate airport hotels. * Largest rooms I've seen in Hong Kong, at least compared to the ones in Kowloon and TST. I stayed in a Superior room, at least 25 m2. * Free wi-fi, and the connection was pretty good. * Good open views. It's facing the Tsing Yi bridge and a container port, ok it's not the views from the Intercontinental or the Westin, but you'll pay at least HK$2500 for these views. * A short 5 min. taxi ride from/to the Maritime Square mall (where the Tsing Yi station is located), a large center with everything, including access to everywhere in Hong Kong. The so-so: * I suspect this and the sister hotel (Rambler Garden next door) are used by Chinese tour groups. Frankly though, very few hotels in HK these days aren't(!). If you happen to be checking in/out when they are there, be patient. The staff though is polite and helpful. * Nothing in the immediate vicinity. The Maritime Square mall is only about 1 km to the north, but walking to/from is difficult and not recommended. After all, the taxi fare is about US$3. * There is loading/unloading at the container port going on 24/7! The windows seem to block out most of the noise, but if you are a light sleeper, bring your ear plugs. My rate came with no breakfast. Now the location: 15 min. from the airport. Depending where in downtown you are going, it can take anywhere from 20-40 min. If you're going to Central, it's an easy and cheap MTR ride on the Tung Chung line. If you're going to TST-East TST, it's at least 35 min. with a transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice last minute accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Suey_Jeffry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our last night at HKG.They upgraded our room to deluxe. Nice clean & spacious room for the 3 of us (2adults 1child). The view was awesome (we stayed on 29th floor). Near to airport. Free shuttle bus to the mtr (request schedule timings from the reception). If not take a cab and it only cost Hkd23. They even provide a portable heater for us in the room (very convenient during winter). The only cons is the loud noises made by China tourists at the corridor. So far happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: ricardobtg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel since there was some sort of convention and most hotels in Kowloon/Hong Kong Island were at ridiculous prices. As I had a late arrival/early departure from the airport, I thought this would be a good option. It was very reasonably priced and location really wasn't too out of the way, about a 5-10 minute taxi ride from the Tsing Yi MTR station. From there its about a 15 minute ride down to Hong Kong Island, quite convenient actually. The hotel room itself is bare bones, everything is clean but the room definitely looks a bit bare. Also, there was no internet access available in my room, not even paid access. If you wanted to go online, you had to go down to the lobby and there really isn't any spot where you can sit and do work. Views of the harbor from the rooms was amazing !! The hotel manager was awesome, she was quite busy tending to a promotional photoshoot but noticed we were waiting for the free shuttle bus to Tsing Yi station. As the shuttle had broken down, she quickly got a taxi for us and paid the bill. Very quick and proactive on her part. All in all this is not a bad choice for a quick stay in HK, or if you get an exceptionally good rate. Otherwise, you're better off choosing something more central or with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY TREATMENT IN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: angrybird46
Reviews.Content: Our first encounter was on 4th November 2011, when we reached the hotel at around 3.30pm for our check-in, we were told that the rooms are not ready please wait. There is a bench infront of the reception counter and the lobby with chairs were cordoned off and no resting place for us a group of 30paxs with children who were tired after the early arrival and city tour. We waited patiently and was shocked when the bell-boy came to tell off some of the kids who were sitting on the floor and the manager gave us a nasty look as if we were some alients. In the end, our last batch to check-in was almost 5pm. Bad service on first day was our verdict. Room service was also bad. We had 2 satchet of coffee and 2 tea for the whole of 4 days there with no top-up even though we used 1 of each on 1st and 2nd day and no coffees and teas for the next two days. Face towels was missing after the cleanup on 1st day and there is none for the whole 3 days after the check-out. Last day was worst which was 7th November 2011 and we had an early check out at 10am and left our bags with the reception and proceed with our last minute shoppings and was back at around 4.30pm before the scheduled pick up time of 5.20pm. We proceed to the reception to collect our bags and thought of packing our last minute catch into our luggage ready for departure. After a long and tiring shopping spree, we thought we can sit around the lobby to do our packing, our kids were again told off by the bell boy to stand up and not to sit at the corner of the lobby. We were quite pissed off as all seats were empty and still being cordoned off and they just refused to let us use them. We were told to go to our pick up bus without even the help of the staff of the hotel to bring our luggage to the bus and worst off we had to put our luggage ourselves into the luggage compartment and worst of the manager can have the cheek to come forward and tell us to give way to taxis coming and not to block the road.This is the worst hotel we had tried in Hong Kong so far....

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dryuti
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 2 nights during our recent visit to hong kong..expensive for the facilities they provide. we were upgraded to deluxe room which was quite spacious with bath tub. but we had another room which was standard i suppose ..quite small room...they have regular bus services from the hotel to main city n near by local attractions which is really good...room service was ok. view outside the room was not worth looking at...best part was it had a departmental store within the complex which was gr8!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, clean and nice room”
Reviews.Author: milkasue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and daughter (4 years old) for 3 nights from 17/10/2011 to 20/10/2011. We choosed to stay in Tsing Yi because we planned to visit Disneyland and Lantau Island the first few days during our stay in Hong Kong. We arrived late in the evening. We took a taxi (RED or GREEN taxis only) from the airport to the hotel and costed us around HKD220, which is cheaper and easier if we were to take the Espress MTR and then hire and taxi or bus from the MTR station to the hotel. We booked a superior room but the staff upgraded us to a Deluxe room with no extra charges. The room is clean, nice, with complete amenities, the view from the windows is superb too. The hotel provides free daily shuttle to the MTR station, which is connected to the Tsing Yi shopping mall. There is a mini mart and a Seven-Eleven underground, where we buy our cup noodle for supper every night ---> 'la mien' cup noodle is delicious! If you wanna get mineral water, get them from the mini mart, selling at HKD7 for 2 big bottles, while you get it for HKD10 for only 1 bottle from any other places. F&B is very limited around the hotel, so it is advisable to have your meal every time you return to the hotel. Overall this is a good hotel, we will recommend this hotel to our friends and will definitely stay in this hotel again next time we visit Hong Kong. Pros: Nice & clean room, helpful & friendly staff, cheap, near to Disneyland and Lantau Island. Cons: Limited food choices, lift is slow, full of (rude) guests from China.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room but inconvenient because of the location and transportation.”
Reviews.Author: AmyChiu
Reviews.Content: It's okay to stay here. The room is clean. But the transportation (shuttle bus) need to be improved. When I just arrived, I am hard to find a bus station to get on the shuttle bus and I just found the bus pass in front of my eyes. That's bad. I asked the stuff to help me but they just responsed that if you wanr to take the bus you need to reservate? How could I reservate at hotel when I just arrive Hong Kong? That's terrible and they are not helpful. It was not the first time I visit HK, but the first time also the last time I choose the Hotel. If you have time and budget on Taxi transport, you can choose the hotel otherwise you should not try this easily.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevenyeee
Reviews.Content: I'd just stayed at this Hotel located at Tsing Yi for 3 days 2 nights, and was allowed to checked out 1 hr later ard 1300hrs. The receptionist are helpful to fulfill our needs. I found the hotel is very clean, the room is ok, not too small for 2 persons, and with the local cantonese tv channels, i quite enjoy the cantonese shows. I lived at the 30th floor, the highest floor but the lift is fast enough to brought me to 30th floor. There is a shopping arcade located at another hotel next to R. Oasis. You can get some stuffs at the convenient shops there, or have some food there as i saw restaurants there. There is a hotel shuttle service to Tsim Sha Tsui at the morning (just 1 timing). There is a bus stop behind the hotel, visitors can take the bus to MTR station or shopping centre at Tsing Yi. I had saw the bus coming quite frequent. Fyi there are 4 lifts at this hotel. If u want a cheaper hotel, and near to Disneyland, Big buddha at Lantau island and near to airport, this is not a bad choice. Some of the negative points: No free wifi/internet at room or lobby. My friend had request the wifi password but been told there is a 50 dollar charge. Usage of the Swimming pool also will be charged Will have to wait for outside taxi if u want to go somewhere far. My friend and i took taxi to Mongkok at night and we got a taxi ard 10min wait, and it took ~25min to Mongkok area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stopover and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: islandsoft_2010
Reviews.Content: Great as a stopover. Convenient to airport using express train + quick taxi ride ride or shuttle bus. Reasonable price. Good or better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: traveltavern28
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded after having booked a single room. My new room (a superior queen) had the most fantastic view of Hong Kong harbour and Hong Kong island. If you are into shipping, containers and other geeky transport stuff as I am, then this place will fascinate you as it looks out over the container ship port. I could have sat all day on my wide window sills staring at the view! Gym is good, although you have to get a piece of paper from the front desk beforehand, as the club is next door and you'll need to sign in. But once you're there, its' very civilised and looks out over an enormous pool - apparently the longest in South East Asia. Location lets this down a little. I stayed here to be near the airport (Tsing Yi is just one stop on the airport train and costs HK$60), but to get to the nearest MTR stop you either have to get a free minibus shuttle to the hotel or a taxi. Granted a taxi is only going to set you back HK$30 (less than £3) but it's still a pain. The orange line is very fast though, and gets you into Kowloon or Hong Kong station very quickly. Internet in your room costs HK$100, but you can use the lobby wifi for free if you just want to check your emails. Would definitely recommend if you're here for a non-airport hotel, as it's cheaper than staying at one of the big brand airport hotels, and also than staying on hong kong island.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights...”
Reviews.Author: Dinamarca
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during a quick pass trough from Hong Kong to Macau & China. Stayed at 30th floor - great view towards one of many container terminals in Hong Kong - Even though it could become a bit loud at night.... Clean room - shower etc & nice bed... but lack of internet-access is a big pain... I booked a "business room" with free internet (Cabel) but it never worked.... Breakfast delivered to Your room as well if business room package is booked... however not the best to say it least... you´re better off getting something elsewhere at a restaurant... All in all You get what You pay for... Payed HKD 900/Night which is very reasonable in Hong Kong - dispite the location ....

Reviews.Title: “Average location, good value and a decent room.”
Reviews.Author: IkeHoke
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife for a week starting at the end of December 2010 and beginning of January 2011. The room was pretty small but clean. We stayed at the 29'th floor and the room was quiet. However, there was no internet in the room and the one in the lobby area was offline most of the time. The main areas of Hong Kong are all accessible with MTR from the Tsing Yi station. From the hotel to the Tsing Yi station, there is a shuttle service which only runs in the morning and some time in the afternoon. It is easy to catch the city minibusses from the entrance of the hotel which costs 3 HKD to the station. It would definitely be a good idea to get an octopus card as soon as possible. There are not many places to eat around the hotel and therefore we ate at the city before returning to the hotel. There is a small mall in the basement of the 3 hotels which are joined. There is a good convenience store (Watsons) in there where the basic utilities and some snacks can be obtained.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, very clean and more and less well located, but no Internet!”
Reviews.Author: AndresVargas
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD We thought this hotel would be so far from everything, but happens to be in a good location not far from the Tsing Yi station (3$ bus, 20$taxi or limited free hotel bus). Perfect for going to Disney, Lantau or even the centre of the city since is just a few stations away. Even if you have a long night at central, a 90$ taxi will take you back to the hotel. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms are really comfortable and the views from the port are just stunning. You can spend hours looking at it and how it works. The staff is friendly and helpful enough, there are shops a couple of restaurants and a 7Eleven in the ground floor. THE BAD But not everything is rose colour... There is NO INTERNET IN THE ROOMS!!! If you go for bussines and you need to be connected this is the wrong place to go... skip it, stay away!! The lack of internet in the hotel is the worst part of it, Honestly that's something that if I knew before Ill totally find something else... but they have WIFI in the lobby, the bad part is that you need to sit in front of the reception where there is not even a table for placing your laptop nor a jack to connect it. They have a side lobby (with fancy chairs, tables and jacks) but seriously is a joke... it has a red band with a note saying is only for long term guests, we stayed there for 6 nights and we didn't qualify for the side lobby... So as soon as we sat there, a friendly worker came and said we must leave cause is only for long term guests... Note that the side lobby was completely empty during all our stay. Something else, if you ant to use the facilities you need to pay much more. One example is the over claimed 200mt pool... They say they have it but you need to pay extra for it every day (either in the morning or the afternoon) is not included at all. The same for the clubhouse and the other gardens and things around, also you have to share those facilities with other hotels and the apartments next to it. And besides those things are always empty or closed. There is no restaurant in the hotel, nor a small shop on it. If you want something you need to go to the 7Eleven, that is a good option but you still need to round all the block and get a bit lost to reach it. Overall, the place is good for a reasonable price. They should work out making the Internet more accessible for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view away from the city crowd.”
Reviews.Author: mycomment666
Reviews.Content: have stayed there for a one year contract at $250 daily rate on average with additional charge of $1000 on every other month between 2009-2010. Room quality: sizes of room vs quality varies VERTICALLY; ie: bigger room=higher ceiling, won't fit in more than 3 luggages. I started 2 days stayed at luxury room on the top floor 30/F, guess what?? i heard people talking 24 hours cuz no soundproof between walls/door. you can either step into the toilet or jump into bed as soon as you open the door. The floor is NOT cleaned so make sure you bring in your slipper tightly worn! And then one day i saw the cleaning staff use the same floor mop to rub the toilet bowl, that i figured why i smell urine after cleaning all the time. Service: do not expect any service quality or professional hospitality from the staff since they considered their "hotel is for public use, what do you expect ?" attitude. only 2 old staff come in to work with a smiley face. I heard comments like "the staff complaint about your complaining all the time, you are a trouble maker!!" from 2 of their frontline staff. Staff told me they are not happy about their job and yawn saying they want a new job and better pay and they wonder why would I stay at this hotel!! that makes me feel uncomfortable and not welcomed at customer level. they like to chit-chat and find out about your personal life! Management: managers get paid by passing their duties to the frontline staff and give them a hard time, i've never seen the managers smile or greet the customers, instead he walked away from the situation at the busiest moment. that's.......more.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean but...........”
Reviews.Author: Osmosis123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel when we found that my wife was dying from cancer and she had always wanted to see Hong Kong so this was supposed to be a final treat for her. Our room was on the 27th floor and the room was small but very clean. The hotel staff were excellent and very helpful. The down side ws that when we went to use the pool we were expected to pay $HK20 per day - that is not mentioned in the advertising. Something else that is not mentioned on their website is that the hotel overlooks one of the busiest container ports in Hong Kong and that the restaurant is in the hotel next door. We were kept awake the first few nights with the noise from the container port but we soon got used to it. What we did not get used to was the rudeness of the restaurant staffe - especially the maitre de and after a few days we decided to eat elsewhere - the service was poor, the staff rude - I do not think that having to wait 45 minutes for a menu is very good - and then another 45 minutes waiting to place our order before deciding to go eat elsewhere! The prices were very expensive also. The good thing was that there is an underground shopping mall just along the road and we ate breakfast in the Coral fast food restaurant, which was much cheaper, better cooked and the staff were friendly!!! The other drawback to this hotel is the distance from the main Hong Kong attracions - it is out in the New Territories and as my wife was by this time frail we had to rely on taxis to go anywhere, but that is a minor concern. The one thing I will say is that if you are brought up to respect people then do not expect it in Hong Kong where they seem to have no manners at all.

Reviews.Title: “I think this hotel it wasn't too bad”
Reviews.Author: travel_da
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I was staying in Rambler Oasis Hotel from end of nov to mid of dec. the price was pretty cheap compare to other hotel in hk. The transportation wasn't that bad, there's N241 Bus from Mong Kok to Tsang Yi(around 10mins walk from Hotel to bus station), this is over night service. around 13 HKD per ride. and there's mini bus station around the around area, around 5 mins walk from hotel to the station. the room was pretty clean. I was living in 29 floors, wasn't too noisy at all. I agree with others, this hotel is full of mainland people. if you're taking the elevator from 8am-10am or 8pm-10pm its take you forever to get in. serious for this price I think you cannot found another hotel. overall it wasn't that bad. I think next time I will going to stay with the same hotel. one more thing, wifi internet service is only in hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “For the price you can get similar room with a better location”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies99
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the staff was helpful, but the location left much to be desired. Though there is a convenient bus stop on the other side of the building complex, you will need to take a bus, to the train to get to the city. After staying there I found that the amount I spent in travel would probably have been made up if I just stayed in the the city. If your desire is to be apart of the the city life and excitement this is not your place. This hotel is actually located NOT on Hong Kong Island, nor is it even located in Kowloon, but rather on a small island between the city and the airport called Tsing Yi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suphamits
Reviews.Content: The transportation is quite a good convenience, The room was very nice & clean. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nosiy Spot”
Reviews.Author: mglireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in rambler oasis on route and return from oz.was generally pleased on route despite lack of restaurant......Was quite noisy at night due to its location next to the extremely large port.access to the city was no problem using the minibus and very efficient mtr. Taxi to the airport was $240 approx including a lot of luggage squashed into the boot ............Our return visit wasnt as good .....had no sleep due to a very noisy party next door but was dealt with promptly when I complained .The worst part was discovering that the sheets on our bed were dirty which we didnt realise until the following morning .....YUK.

Reviews.Title: “Family group tour in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: Rambler Oasis Hotel, $127. (HK$ 900.00 plus 10% services charge per room per night(room only). This hotel is not close to MTR (subway) station, need to take a 5 minute mini-bus. This hotel is mainly cater to mainland Chinese tourists to Hong Kong. Room price is very competitive. And room reservation can be made directly to the hotel at good rates. There are quite a few less desirable points: 1. Location: you need to take the MTR to either Kwai Fong or Tsing Yi station and take the green mini bus #88G or #88F to the hotel. These mini bus are basically for commuters and typical tourists with typical luggage (say 26” like I was carrying) will be very difficult. You need to take the taxi from the Kwai Fong MTR station to the hotel. We toke 3 taxis for 10 people, and was charged 45, 55, and 75 for the same exact identical trip – that said about Hong Kong Taxi drivers rip off (constant loud claim of never making enough). Shuttle from the airport is available at $110 a trip. But the actual distances is not far. Lugging heavy luggage in the MTR station steps are not much fun. 2. Small room, but comparable in typical Hong Kong hotel standard. Like living in campus. No electrical outlet in bathroom. 2 T-shape sockets left in the 6 slot power strip in closet. 3. In the hotel info sheet, there is no food available. But, at the other side of other hotel building, in this small Tsing Yi island, there is a restaurant, and entire shopping mall, with fast food court and Parkson super market. 4. Hardly any surface for luggage in the room. No drawers, of course. One bottle of water, even, we stay for quite a few days. 5. Only 2 light switches in the room. One for bathroom. One for bedroom. Any truing on the light will certainly wake up every one in the room. Bathroom frosted glass partitions awake sleepers in the bedroom. 6. Good and strong Air conditioning. But hard to control reasonable comfort to sleep. 7. Large 300m swimming pool. But the water is cool and too much Chlorine, burn my eyes. Free Broadband, but stupid and complicated sign on process, every time I power on.

Reviews.Title: “Fell in love with Rambler Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LoveLightBlue
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I chose Rambler Oasis. At first I had my apprehensions regarding the location but it worked well for us. Just a short travel time after our flight in (good thing I printed the map provided at the hotel's site so it was easy for the cab drivers to know where we wanted to go) & we need not rush back for our flight out. We didn't mind taking the cab whenever we got out of the hotel because there were four of us traveling, so a HK$20 cab fare (HK$5 each) to Tsing Yi station was not a big deal. The staff at this hotel (Rambler Oasis) were very nice, helpful, & accommodating. The rooms were nice & kept clean everyday, although just a heads up on the size of the rooms, they were more of an Asian standards rather than American. I love the way they put a dispenser of shampoo, conditioner, & body wash all in one, at least I wouldn't waste time squeezing these things out of tiny bottles. I wouldn't have to limit myself using it! I read a lot about not being able to sleep at all because of the noise outside, but honestly speaking I didn't hear a thing. If there "were" some noise, it seemed they were very distant & didn't bother us at all. I liked the fact that at the end of a tiring day, we were coming back at a peaceful neighborhood, distant from all the "chaos" of HK. Also I love the pool! I thought it was free for anyone staying at the hotel but I learned that the pool was like a clubhouse also for the residents around the hotel so we had to pay HK$20 each which was ok. I was pleasantly surprised to find that there was a 7/11, a supermarket, & a Cafe de Coral (a restaurant which was cheap, delicious, fast with huge servings) nearby (below Rambler Plaza) among other things. Overall we had a pleasant stay & we enjoyed every minute of it. I would definitely come back & stay at this hotel the next time I'm in Hong Kong. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “For short stay. Spartanian conditions.”
Reviews.Author: Tikhon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. First impression - this is simple student hostel...I have changed my first room due to it was simply dusty and smell sigarets. Second one was cleaner. Both rooms was very small - around 12 sq m. Bathroom is a section 4.5 sq m. The biggest problem was to found power socket in the room. I have unplugged TV to charge my phone. What else.... The hotel is too far from everywhere. You'll spend for taxi a lot - so think in advance... May be to stay in HGK will be cheaper?:) And the last but actually very important - they have no restaurant. And no any closer than 20 minutes walk. My recomendation - for backpackers who know how to use a bus and metro. Also for groups of people - not for individuals. too boring place... Why I was quite satisfied? I have paid for this 45USD only... So it was quite close to my estimations^) Good luck! Never save money on yourself!:)

HotelInfo.Name: Rambler Oasis Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.1 Tsing Yi Road, Tsing Yi, Hong Kong, China
